DataElement.preferredName: Subject Activity Group Plan Study Activity Comment ISO21090.ST.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A collection of activities that are intended to occur or start for the same study subject at a specific point in the context of a particular study. EXAMPLE(S): (1) Clinic visit during which a physical exam, a blood test, and a substance administration occur (2) Telephone contact during which temperature, blood pressure and adverse events are reported (3) Recording multiple observation results in a diary (4) A treatment strategy that consists of drug administrations with rules for modifying doses OTHER NAME(S): visit, time point, study segment, course, treatment strategy, period, cycle Additional description of the activity. EXAMPLE(S): Guidance on how to perform the observation. (for a defined observation comment).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Subject Activity Group Plan Study Activity Comment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Some matter, situation, or event that is thought about, written about, or discussed.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.:Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit.:To devise, contrive, or form in design.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._A written explanation or criticism or illustration that is added to a book or other textual material.
